Title: A Night to Remember
Synopsis: A shell-shocked soldier’s return from war strains his marriage and identity, pushing him toward a desperate act.

Title: A Song to Remember
Synopsis: Chopin’s genius blossoms under political upheaval and a tempestuous romance with George Sand.

Title: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
Synopsis: A young girl comes of age while her family fights to survive poverty and heartbreak in early Brooklyn.

Title: Abroad With Two Yanks
Synopsis: Two Marines on leave stumble into danger and romance when they cross a nightclub singer with a secret.

Title: Alaska
Stars: Kent Taylor, Margaret Lindsay, John Carradine
Synopsis: Adventure-drama about frontier rivalry, murder, and redemption in the Alaskan wilderness.

Title: Attack
Stars: Jack Palance, Eddie Albert, Lee Marvin
Synopsis: WWII drama on command cowardice and moral conflict. *(Note: post-1945)*

Title: Bahama Passage
Synopsis: A foreman and his boss’s daughter clash and fall in love on a Caribbean island poised for unrest.

Title: Beachhead to Berlin
Synopsis: Documentary compiled from Allied combat footage chronicling amphibious assaults in the Pacific theater.

Title: Between Two Women
Synopsis: A junior doctor balances ambition and love while navigating loyalty inside a pressure-cooker hospital.

Title: Bluebeard
Synopsis: A Parisian painter hides a murderous secret as his portraits become graves for the women who inspire them.

Title: Bombalera
Synopsis: Unverified title. Could not identify a pre-1946 film with this exact name; likely a misspelling or alternate title (e.g., 'Bombardier' 1943). Needs manual check.

Title: Buckskin Frontier
Synopsis: A railroad scout and a gambler’s daughter find love and conflict as trains push west into hostile territory.

Title: Candy's Dream Girl
Stars: Jane Powell; Ralph Bell; Carmen Amaya
Synopsis: A wartime musical short built around stage performer Candy Johnson, whose whirlwind daydream sparkles with swing routines and specialty acts staged for servicemen.

Title: Dark Mountain
Synopsis: On the run from the mob, a businessman’s remarried ex-wife must choose between safety and love in the wilderness.

Title: Dark Waters
Synopsis: A traumatized young woman suspects her relatives’ Southern mansion hides deadly intentions.

Title: Days of Glory
Synopsis: Soviet partisans fight Nazis in the forest where courage and sacrifice become daily ration.

Title: Enter Arsène Lupin
Stars: Charles Korvin, Ella Raines, J. Carrol Naish
Synopsis: Gentleman thief Lupin foils a criminal plot targeting a young heiress aboard a London train.

Title: Escort Girl
Synopsis: A nightclub hostess hides her profession to protect her daughter from corruption.

Title: Experiment Perilous
Synopsis: A psychiatrist is drawn into a glamorous woman’s dangerous domestic nightmare in Manhattan.

Title: Fast Company
Synopsis: Rare-book dealers moonlight as amateur sleuths investigating a collector’s murder.

Title: Frisco Sal
Stars: Susanna Foster, Turhan Bey, Alan Curtis
Synopsis: Nightclub singer seeks revenge for her brother’s death on the Barbary Coast.

Title: German Atrocities--Lublin Death Factory
Synopsis: Liberation footage of the Majdanek concentration camp assembled to expose Nazi war crimes to Allied audiences under the German Atrocities newsreel banner.

Title: God Is My Co-Pilot
Stars: Dennis Morgan, Dane Clark, Raymond Massey
Synopsis: Biopic of Flying Tiger pilot Robert L. Scott Jr., dramatizing his WWII missions in China.

Title: Guest in the House
Synopsis: A manipulative convalescent disrupts a painter’s household through deceit and obsession.

Title: Gypsy Wildcat
Synopsis: A woman raised among gypsies learns the secret of her birth while resisting tyranny.

Title: Hangover Square
Stars: Laird Cregar, Linda Darnell, George Sanders
Synopsis: Period noir of a composer’s murderous blackouts and descent into madness.

Title: Heather and Yon
Synopsis: Short subject (archival data scarce).

Title: Heavenly Days
Synopsis: A patriotic comedy of civilians visiting Washington, D.C. during WWII and stumbling through bureaucracy.

Title: Here Come the Co-Eds
Stars: Bud Abbott, Lou Costello, Peggy Ryan
Synopsis: Comic chaos as two caretakers try to save a women’s college from foreclosure.

Title: Here Come the Waves
Synopsis: Musical salute to the Navy WAVES with songs, romance, and wartime morale.

Title: Hotel Berlin
Stars: Faye Emerson; Helmut Dantine; Raymond Massey; Andrea King
Synopsis: Hotel Berlin is an American drama film made by Warner Bros. in late 1944 to early 1945 starring Faye Emerson, Helmut Dantine, Raymond Massey and Andrea King. Directed by Peter Godfrey, it is set in Berlin near the close of World War II, and is based on the novel Hotel Berlin by Vicki Baum.

Title: Ice-Capades Revue
Stars: Ellen Drew; Richard Denning; Jerry Colonna; Barbara Jo Allen
Synopsis: Backstage musical about launching a rival ice show, built around the touring Ice-Capades troupe.

Title: In Old California
Stars: John Wayne; Binnie Barnes; Albert Dekker; Helen Parrish
Synopsis: Gold Rush–era pharmacist takes on a corrupt saloon boss in Sacramento.

Title: Isle of Tabu
Stars: Susanna Foster; David Bruce; Turhan Bey
Synopsis: A South Seas adventure-romance in which an American nurse marooned on a Polynesian isle uncovers smuggling and forbidden rituals while choosing between duty and love.

Title: I’ll Be Seeing You
Stars: Ginger Rogers, Joseph Cotten, Shirley Temple
Synopsis: Tender Christmas romance between a parolee and a PTSD-stricken soldier.

Title: I’ll Sell My Life
Synopsis: Reporter’s strange ad leads to intrigue and murder in this low-budget thriller.

Title: Keep Your Powder Dry
Stars: Lana Turner; Susan Peters; Laraine Day; Agnes Moorehead
Synopsis: Keep Your Powder Dry is a 1945 American drama film directed by Edward Buzzell and starring Lana Turner, Susan Peters, and Laraine Day. Its plot follows three women who join the Women's Army Corps during World War II. The screenplay was written by George Bruce and Mary C. McCall, Jr.

Title: Lake Placid Serenade
Stars: Vera Ralston; Eugene Pallette; Alan Curtis; Barbara Jo Allen
Synopsis: Ukrainian skater finds opportunity and romance in upstate New York; Republic ice-skating musical.

Title: Lili Marlene
Stars: Dorothy Lamour; John Hodiak; Patricia Morison
Synopsis: Drama inspired by the famed wartime song, following a cabaret singer torn between her Nazi lover and an Allied spy as Europe descends into war.

Title: Lucky Jordan
Stars: Alan Ladd; Helen Walker; Sheldon Leonard
Synopsis: A draft-dodging New York gangster stumbles into a spy plot and reluctant patriotism.

Title: Made for Each Other
Stars: Carole Lombard; James Stewart; Charles Coburn
Synopsis: Newlyweds struggle through financial hardship and personal crises in New York.

Title: Mark of the Whistler
Synopsis: A drifter adopts a dead man’s identity for his inheritance — but danger follows.

Title: Meet Me in St. Louis
Stars: Judy Garland; Margaret O’Brien; Mary Astor
Synopsis: Turn-of-the-century family musical built around the 1904 World’s Fair; includes “Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas.”
Awards: Oscar nominations (incl. Best Cinematography, Best Song)

Title: Ministry of Fear
Synopsis: Man accidentally entangled in a Nazi spy ring after winning a cake.

Title: Moonlight and Cactus
Synopsis: Three traveling singers get stranded at a desert ranch where romance and sabotage collide.

Title: Music for Millions
Synopsis: A pregnant woman fears her soldier husband’s fate while an orchestra shields her from heartbreak.

Title: Music in Manhattan
Stars: Anne Shirley; Dennis Day; Phillip Terry
Synopsis: A mistaken-identity romance propels two small-time performers toward the big time; musical comedy.

Title: Nevada
Synopsis: A cowboy with a new identity returns to face a corrupt cattle baron and his gang.

Title: Objective, Burma!
Stars: Errol Flynn; James Brown; William Prince
Synopsis: Objective, Burma! is a 1945 American war film that is loosely based on the six-month raid by Merrill's Marauders in the Burma Campaign during the Second World War. Directed by Raoul Walsh and starring Errol Flynn, the film was made by Warner Bros. immediately after the raid.

Title: Our Hearts Were Young and Gay
Stars: Gail Russell; Diana Lynn; Charlie Ruggles; Dorothy Gish
Synopsis: Our Hearts Were Young and Gay is a 1944 American comedy film directed by Lewis Allen and written by Sheridan Gibney, based on the memoir by Emily Kimbrough and Cornelia Otis Skinner about their misadventures abroad.

Title: Partners of the Trail
Synopsis: Frontier marshals pursue a scheming land baron’s violent land-grab.

Title: Practically Yours
Synopsis: Radio correspondent returns from war to a comedic case of mistaken engagement.

Title: Rough, Tough and Ready
Stars: Chester Morris; Victor McLaglen; Jean Rogers
Synopsis: Rough, Tough and Ready is a 1945 American war comedy drama film directed by Del Lord and starring Chester Morris, Victor McLaglen and Jean Rogers about two merchant seamen drawn back into wartime service.

Title: Salty O'Rourke
Synopsis: Salty O'Rourke is a 1945 American sports drama directed by Raoul Walsh in which a racetrack grifter turns a hot-headed jockey into a contender while falling for the trainer who can save them both.

Title: Sergeant Mike
Stars: Larry Parks; Jeanne Bates; Loren Tindall
Synopsis: Sergeant Mike is a 1944 American drama directed by Henry Levin about a war correspondent whose adopted pup becomes a Marine mascot and morale booster.

Title: She's a Soldier Too
Stars: Beulah Bondi; Nina Foch; Jess Barker; Lloyd Bridges
Synopsis: She's a Soldier Too is a 1944 American drama directed by William Castle following three women whose lives intersect through wartime service and sacrifice on the home front.

Title: Shine On, Harvest Moon
Stars: Ann Sheridan; Dennis Morgan; Jack Carson
Synopsis: Shine On, Harvest Moon is a 1944 musical biopic directed by David Butler dramatizing the vaudeville partnership and romance of songwriters Nora Bayes and Jack Norworth.

Title: Since You Went Away
Stars: Claudette Colbert; Jennifer Jones; Joseph Cotten; Shirley Temple
Synopsis: Since You Went Away is a 1944 American epic wartime drama directed by John Cromwell chronicling how a middle-class family endures separation and sacrifice while the patriarch serves overseas.
Awards: Won Academy Award for Best Original Score

Title: Something for the Boys
Stars: Carmen Miranda Michael O'Shea Vivian Blaine Phil Silvers
Synopsis: Something for the Boys is a 1944 musical comedy directed by Lewis Seiler in which three cousins inherit a Texas ranch and turn it into a USO training camp full of music, mishaps, and romance.

Title: Storm Over Lisbon
Synopsis: A nightclub owner gets drawn into espionage when an American pilot seeks escape from Nazi agents.

Title: Strange Affair
Synopsis: A naval cadet investigates his brother’s death and uncovers blackmail and deceit.

Title: Sunday Dinner for a Soldier
Synopsis: Sunday Dinner for a Soldier is a 1944 wartime drama directed by Lloyd Bacon about a struggling Florida family who save for months to host a lonely serviceman, only to find unexpected love instead.

Title: Sundown Valley
Synopsis: A rancher resists a mine owner’s tyranny while defending his home.

Title: Swing Hostess
Synopsis: Telephone operator lands radio singing gig in B-musical vehicle for Tilton.

Title: Tampico
Stars: Edward G. Robinson; Lynn Bari; Victor McLaglen
Synopsis: Tampico is a 1944 wartime suspense film directed by Lothar Mendes about a sea captain who rescues a mysterious survivor and uncovers a Nazi sabotage plot in the Gulf of Mexico.

Title: The Ape
Synopsis: A doctor dons an ape-suit to harvest spinal fluid from terrified victims in hopes of curing paralysis.

Title: The Ape Man
Stars: Bela Lugosi; Louise Currie; Wallace Ford
Synopsis: The Ape Man is a 1943 horror feature directed by William Beaudine starring Bela Lugosi as a scientist whose experiments leave him half-simian and desperate for a cure.

Title: The Big Showoff
Stars: Arthur Lake; Dale Evans; Lionel Stander
Synopsis: The Big Show-Off is a 1945 Republic Pictures comedy directed by Howard Bretherton in which a meek pianist poses as a masked pugilist to impress a nightclub singer.

Title: The Climax
Synopsis: A sinister physician obsessed with a vanished star plots to silence a new opera singer forever.

Title: The Devil Bat
Synopsis: A mad scientist trains giant bats to kill his enemies by scent.

Title: The Falcon in Hollywood
Stars: Tom Conway; Barbara Hale; Jean Brooks; Rita Corday
Synopsis: Sleuth Tom Lawrence (‘The Falcon’) investigates a murder on an RKO studio lot amid Hollywood intrigue.

Title: The Fighting Lady
Synopsis: The Fighting Lady is a 1944 Technicolor Navy documentary directed by Edward Steichen that chronicles a U.S. aircraft carrier and its crew through Pacific theater combat.
Awards: Won Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature

Title: The Keys of the Kingdom
Stars: Gregory Peck; Thomas Mitchell; Vincent Price; Rose Stradner
Synopsis: A humble Scottish priest’s decades of missionary work in China; reflective religious drama.

Title: The Navy Way
Synopsis: A sailor competes for love and honor at a wartime training base.

Title: The Sky’s the Limit
Synopsis: A pilot on leave hides his identity and trauma while falling for a photographer.

Title: The Strangler
Stars: Victor Jory; Otto Kruger; June Duprez
Synopsis: Noir thriller about a returning soldier haunted by blackouts who fears he may be the serial killer stalking women through a blackout-shrouded city.

Title: The Thin Man Goes Home
Synopsis: Nick and Nora vacation with his parents — but murder tags along.

Title: The Unseen
Stars: Joel McCrea; Gail Russell; Herbert Marshall
Synopsis: The Unseen is a 1945 mystery thriller directed by Lewis Allen about a governess who suspects the widower she works for is linked to a string of murders in their gloomy row house.

Title: The Woman in the Window
Stars: Edward G. Robinson, Joan Bennett, Raymond Massey
Synopsis: Professor’s chance encounter with a mysterious woman leads to murder and guilt.

Title: Thoroughbreds
Stars: Tom Neal; Adele Mara; Roger Pryor
Synopsis: Thoroughbreds is a 1944 Republic Pictures racing drama directed by George Blair about a struggling stable owner pinning his hopes on an upstart colt and a talented jockey.

Title: Three Is a Family
Stars: Marjorie Reynolds; Charlie Ruggles; Fay Bainter
Synopsis: Three Is a Family is a 1944 comedy directed by Edward Ludwig following a couple whose cramped New York apartment bursts with relatives after wartime housing shortages.
Awards: Academy Award nomination for Best Sound Recording

Title: To Have and Have Not
Stars: Humphrey Bogart; Lauren Bacall; Walter Brennan
Synopsis: To Have and Have Not is a 1944 romantic adventure directed by Howard Hawks pairing Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall in a wartime tale of smugglers aiding the French Resistance in Martinique.

Title: Tonight and Every Night
Synopsis: A music hall troupe keeps performing through the Blitz, refusing to surrender joy to war.

Title: Topper
Synopsis: An uptight banker’s life spins into chaos when two carefree spirits push him toward joy.

Title: Turnabout
Synopsis: A feuding couple swap bodies after a mystical curse and must live one another’s lives.

Title: Two Girls and a Sailor
Stars: June Allyson, Gloria DeHaven, Van Johnson
Synopsis: Sisters open a canteen for servicemen and find love amid musical numbers.

Title: Wedded Bliss
Synopsis: A postwar comedy short chronicling newlyweds whose bargain honeymoon cabin turns into a farcical parade of relatives and mishaps before true bliss sets in.

Title: When the Lights Go on Again
Stars: Jimmy Lydon; Barbara Belden; Regis Toomey
Synopsis: When the Lights Go on Again is a 1944 drama directed by William K. Howard about a young man leaving his small town to fight overseas while his family wrestles with rationing, housing shortages, and hope for reunion.

Title: Woo Woo
Stars: Kay Kyser; Georgia Carroll; Harry Babbitt
Synopsis: A jitterbug-filled musical short where Kay Kyser and his band debut the novelty tune 'Whooo?' for an ecstatic ballroom crowd.

Title: Youth on Trial
Synopsis: Courtroom drama about a boy who shoots his abusive stepfather and the debate over guilt and trauma.
